page.title: 14Acklington Village Hall
page.content: {Acklington Village Hall}was built in 1925 at the second attempt (a gale blew most of it down while it was under construction). It is a red bricked building, not very glamorous but with{good amenities}(kitchen, toilets, hall, meeting room, stage, storage rooms, small car park etc.) and is well used by villagers.{Clubs that use it regularly are: Badminton Club, Carpet Bowls Club, Autumn Club (Senior Citizens) and the Women's Institute. It is also frequently used by the{church}for functions such as Coffee Mornings, Suppers, P.C.C. meetings and occasional Dances and Concerts. It is also used for parties, elections and village celebrations. The{charges}are very low, ranging from Â£1 to Â£5 (depending on what is used and for how long), which is one reason why the hall is in use most nights.
